headline.main: Hypertension Plan Found to Save Lives

docs.abstract: Article on success of Westchester County, NY, screening program; cardiologist, Dr Marvin Moser, Joyce James, program coordinator and Kay Mencher of Scarsdale Volunteer Ambulance Corps comment (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: A six-year campaign to persuade the public that high blood pressure is a treatable condition is having results in Westchester, according to Dr. Marvin Moser, a White Plains cardiologist who is a consultant to a national education program on hypertension.

headline.main: THE AIR: UNSAFE AT ANY SITE

docs.abstract: Article on air pollution notes new research suggests that fine particulates, clouds of invisible pollutants carried hundreds of miles from their source by wind, represent major health hazard in sizable areas of US; findings outlined; illus (L)
docs.lead_paragraph: Clarence Webster gets on the train for Pelham and by chance finds himself on the smoker. He doesn't smoke, and the initial shock of the air is staggering; he rushes to the next car. The air there is better, and he's O.K. After he gets ...
